titles.title: Mǝʿǝraf, The Common of the Office

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Mǝʿǝraf, The Common of the Office (fols. 3ra-63vb) I-1) Wazema, The Office of Vigils (fols. 3ra-8ra) I-2) Mäwäddǝs, The Sunday Office (fols. 8ra-18rb) I-3) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “Gate of Light” (fols. 18rb-20rb) I-4) Sǝbḥatä nägh, The Office of Matins (fols. 20rb-25rb) I-5) Zä-mäwaʿǝlä ʾaṣwam, The Office for Lent (fols. 25rb-43vb) I-6) ʾArǝʾstä mǝhǝlla [zä-Dawit], Rogation (fols. 43vb-48va) I-7) Qalä bäräkät zä-Yared, Blessing of Yared (fols. 48va-49vb) I-8) Zä-yǝnäggǝś zä-ʾabunä Yared, Supplications of Yared (fols. 50ra-51vb) I-9) Kǝśtät zä-ʾaryam, The festive Office (fols. 52ra-58va) I-10) Mästäbqwǝʿ, Supplications (fols. 58va-62rb) I-11) Ṣälotä kidan zä-śälästu gizeyat “Covenant Prayer of the Three Hours” (fols. 62rb-63vb).

txstates.txstate: The front board is broken and repaired with metal wire. The Ms. has been resewn. Some fols. are stained with dirt, water and wax. Two pieces of fol. 45 have been cut out. Holes carefully amended in fols. 25, 37, 39, 63, 64.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the front board is broken and repaired). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex.

inks.ink: Black, red (vivid scarlet, vivid crimson on fol. 52ra)

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – V(7; s.l.: 4, stub before 3/fols. 35r-41v) – VI(10/fols. 42r-51v) – VII(8/fols. 52r-59v) – VIII(4/fols. 60r-63v).

taunit.rl-info:
Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The upper line is written below the ruling on fols. 30r-33v.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: fine, careful; hand b: mediocre, careless

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 3ra-49vb, 52ra-63rb; on fols. 40v-41v the handwriting becomes conspicuously right-sloping. Hand b: fols. 50ra-51vb; the handwriting is right-sloping.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; titles of Texts I-1 to I-11; names of supplications, antiphons and chants (often their initial letters), and their abbreviations (e.g., mästäbqʷǝʿ, mǝqnay, mǝlṭan, mäzmur, sälam, mǝhǝla, ʾarǝʾst); initial words of supplications and prayers in Text I-10; names of feasts and other occasions; interlinear musical signs (e.g., fols. 44rab-45ra, 49vb); directives for the ministers; names of the categories of melody and their abbreviations (ʿǝzl, gǝʿǝz, ʾararay); elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals and/or their elements. Two lines (alternating with a black line) on the incipit page; two lines (alternating with a black line) of the incipit of Texts I-2, I-5 and I-6; two lines of the incipit of Texts I-3 and I-7.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ምቅ፡ for ምቅናይ፡ ምልጣ፡ for ምልጣን፡ ምድ፡/ምድጋ፡ for ምድጋም፡ ዕዝ፡ for ዕዝል፡ ቅንዋ፡ for ቅንዋት፡ ይ፡ ካህ for ይቤ፡ ካህን ይ፡ ዲ፡ for ይቤ፡ ዲያቆን፡ ይ፡ ሕ፡ for ይቤ፡ ሕዝብ፡

extras.extra: - Tämälläs-sign, in the shape of two perpendicular lines, indicating the place where the omissions, written in the margins, belong, in the main hand: fols. 3vb l.13, 5va l.12, 8rb l.22, 9rb l.2, 33vb l.10, 36vb l.23, 49vb l.19. - Tämälläs-sign, in the shape of a cross or two perpendicular lines, indicating the place where the omissions, written in the margins, belong, in secondary hands: fols. 3rb l.19, 4ra l.4, 5rb l.24, 10vb l.14, 21va l.19, 22ra l.5, 38vb l.23, 40ra l.5. - Omitted words and passages written in the margins: fols. 3rb, 3va, 4ra, 6vb, 7rb, 8va, 9ra, 9va, 11rb, 12va, 14ra, 15ra, 19rb, 20rb, 22vb, 23rb, 24va, 26va, 30rb, 30va, 31rb, 31vb, 32rb, 38rab, 39ra, 40rb, 40vab, 41ra, 43rb, 44rb, 50rb, 51ra, 51va, 57vab, 60r, 61rab, 63v. - Erasures: fols. 8rb, 12vb. - Erasures marked with thin lines: fols. 19rb, 54ra. - A sign, in the shape of a cross with a circle at the ends of the vertical arm, is written in the side margins: fol. 3v. - A few lines on fol. 49vb are written in a smaller script. - Lack of rubrication on fols. 53vb-54vb, 62ra-63vb. - Minor note, in Amharic and Gǝʿǝz: fol. 55va (in the bottom margin). - Pen trial: fols. 1v, 2r, 29v, 34vb, 45r, 59v. - Scribbles, writing exercises, doodles: fols. 1v, 2r, 23vb, 33vb, 34ra, 60r, 63v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - The liturgical period, for which Text I-1 is used, is indicated in the upper margin of fol. 3va (in red): በሰናብት፡ ወበዓላት. - Daily readings are indicated by the names of the days of the week written in the upper margin, in a secondary hand (?): ዘሠኑይ: fol. 26ra ዘሠሉስ: fol. 29ra ዘረቡዕ: fol. 30vb ዘሐሙስ: fol. 32rb ዘዓርብ: fol. 34ra ዘቀዳሚት: fol. 35va.

frames.frame: Fol. 49vb (explicit of Text I-7) three short and simple ornamental bands; geometric motifs. Fol. 62rb (explicit of Text I-10): simple, uncoloured ornamental band; geometric motifs.
